newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - July 25.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - July 25.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Vice President Joseph Estrada still leads among 10 other presidential aspirants, but his rating has leveled off, while those of Senators Miriam Defensor-Santiago and Raul Roco and Defense Secretary Renato de Villa keep rising. (PHILIPPINE DAILY INQUIRER)

- Members of the Integrated Bar of the Philippines and the Philippine Judges Association are considering a nationwide boycott of court sessions if the government fails to address their concern over the killing and abduction of judges and lawyers. (MANILA TIMES)
- Andrew Cunanan's run from the law ends when he kills himself in a houseboat on Indian Creek, a few miles from fashion designer Gianni Versace's mansion in South Beach. (ALL PAPERS)
- Two senators, formerly with the opposition party, have decided to join the administration party. (MANILA BULLETIN)
- The central bank says it is comfortable with the present 28 pesos to $1 trading range prevailing at the Philippine Dealing System (BUSINESS DAILY)

- Banker and takeover specialist Edgardo Espiritu has bought a minority stake in oil and mining exploration firm Alcorn Petroleum and Minerals Corp. He has taken two seats on the company's seven-man board. (MANILA TIMES)
- Monetary authorities order banks to get clearance before they can enter into options to buy or sell dollars from non-resident clients (MANILA BULLETIN)
- The central bank is expected to keep its interest rates high in the near term as the foreign exchange market has yet to return to normal trading condition. (BUSINESSWORLD)
